data.title: Tasty and Good Value
data.text: This place was in front of our hotel, so we stopped in for dinner. The cold dishes off the passing train were fine, but we also got some dishes that are best served hot and they were not, such as the spring rolls and edamame.  I ordered a miso soup that was loaded with tofu and tasted good, but it was served lukewarm.  It would have been better hot.  I also ordered salmon  with vegetables and it was hot and delicious.

data.title: Not a good Value
data.text:
Most likely won't come back. .
Some of the sushi rolls had off taste.
Teriyaki chicken plate also tasted off.
As if cleaning chemicals permeated everything

data.title: Fun, Quick, Sushi!
data.text:
I don't really qualify as a traveler for this, since I live in the townhouse across the street from the San Marcos Hotel and come here fairly frequently...but if you happen to be visiting Arizona, you won't go wrong here if you find yourself in Downtown Chandler.  You can spend as much or as little as you want (all plates are $2 as others have mentioned, plus Kirin drafts always $1.99!), and you can also spend as much or as little time as you want.  If you want to sit down with friends for over an hour, you can do that.  If you want to grab two quick plates at the conveyor belt and be in and out in 5 minutes, you can do that, too (I'm told this is how these places work in Japan).

Plus, the place has this quasi-European vibe in that they usually play dance music over the speakers, maybe at one or two notches higher volume than normal, but it only adds to the atmosphere, I think.

data.title: $2 sushi plates!
data.text:
This place has sushi going around on a belt & all plates are $2. But they have a full menu in addition to that. I had a great tofu avocado salad & my husband had sushi. They have a full bar too.

Our check was reasonable & the food was great! This place is right in downtown chandler & right across from the San Marcos

data.title: Fun lunch!
data.text: We stopped by for lunch at Eastward.  The service was great and staff were helpful with both food and drink suggestions.  Great prices for great sushi!

data.title: Rolling Sushi
data.text: Sit at sushi bar for quicker service...and pick your own sushi..which is constantly being made and rolling by.  Quality above average.  Great value.

data.title: Neat experience and really good sushi
data.text: When I saw the sign for $2 sushi I was worried that this would be one of those situations where you get what you pay for. Based on the reviews though, I decided to give the place a try. Glad I did because the sushi was legitimately good and the conveyor belt delivery was neat to watch - something I'd never experienced before. The sushi plates had on average 3 pieces each. Other things that came through on the belt were tempura shrimp, pot stickers, seaweed salad, and cheesecake. As others have said, your bill is $2 X the number of plates you get, regardless of what's on the plate. I was full after 4 plates...but kept eating til 6. ;-)

data.title: Love this place for the price!
data.text: Good sushi, extensive menu if you're not into sushi, great staff, and very cheap! Even the entree's on the menu are a good price. Love this place.

data.title: All around good!
data.text: Oftentimes cheap sushi is not good, but this place is the exception.  Their sushi was tasty and the fact that it passes by you on a conveyor belt and you can grab whatever you want makes it even better.  We had 37 plates of sushi and our food bill came out to just $74!  Even better, the drinks portion of our bill was equally good thanks to $1.99 drafts of Kirin.  Good value, friendly service and quality food makes this place a winner!  We'll be back for sure.

data.title: Cheap and always good.
data.text: We have been here a couple of times and always have a great experience. As far as sushi prices go you can get out for two people for just over $20 bucks at just $2 per plate.

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text: You don't expect to find good sushi in a southwestern town, but Eastwind is good!  You can order from the menu or pull dishes off the rotating belt.  All dishes are a standard prices so you don't have to worry about plate color etc.

data.title: Great place for cheap sushi
data.text: $2 sushi on a conveyor belt.  Came here for dinner and was pleasantly surprised.  Staff was great and the sushi was pretty tasty.  They had many different rolls, potstickers and even dessert.

data.title: EastWind Sushi Rocks!
data.text: I absolutely LOVE this place!  Their sushi is among the best in quality, great atmosphere, friendly service, and oh so reasonably priced!  OMG!  You can't do any better for a sushi experience.

data.title: Wonderful
data.text:
We did not get any Sushi conveyor foods, although this was HIGHLY entertaining to watch, while waiting for our takeout order.
We walked in, looked at a menu, ordered and waited for takeout.  They offered us water and were exceptionally friendly!
We were staying at the RESORT across the street. We both ordered Noodle dishes and they were wonderful!! Fresh and hot! If we stay here again we will definitely stop in again!

data.title: FAN-TAS-TIC
data.text:
EXCELLENT IN EVERY WAY!!! 

SERVICE is perfect, atmosphere is very nice & the food is awesome!!!

I had the Saigon seafood plate... It is great!

I stringless suggest this place!!

data.title: Wonderful service, fresh food, great value
data.text: We were taken by family who are regulars at this little neighbourhood spot. Such friendly personable service. Lots of variety with conveyer belt offerings. Fresh and very tasty.  And a really wonderful value.

data.title: Great Sushi at a really good price
data.text: Sushi plates go around bar in front of you and were priced at $2.00 each. Most plates had 3 pieces of roll on them. Really good selection of rolls. Good happy hour  beer price $1.99 draft.

data.title: Great value with small atmosphere
data.text: We went for the $2 sushi ate night, can't go wrong at that price as long as you don't get sick!   The service was great and the sushi area kept coming to I was full.  Good value for sushi, I would definitely return!

data.title: Fast and Good!
data.text: Small shop with excellent customer service. I'm a regular there and they'll cut me deals often. Sushi is very high quality and their Eastwind Roll is delicious. With $2 plate specials how can you resist?

data.title: Really good Sushi! Great lunch stop in downtown Chandler-
data.text: Friendly, small but nice decor,  sushi stop. They have a great choice of very fresh and well-prepared $2.00 choices on the "conveyor belt" style of serve-your-self sushi. Sit-down meals have a great variety of choices also, and it won't break the bank. My chirashi was prepared more Korean-style with a great hot chili-oil condiment on the side, with loads of fresh greens, avocado, you name it, and also, of course, sashimi-style cuts of fish. Really enjoyed it, and the staff are very welcoming...
